fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Trade, Competition, Culture, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society, Sport
eu_initiatives: Policies and initiatives within DG EAC and DG EMPL, the European Semester. Education policy in the European Parliament, especially in CULT, Erasmus+, Education Area 2025, New Skills Agenda, The social pillar and social scoreboard, trade policy
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
Education International, EI 
European Trade Union Committee for Education, ETUCE
goals__remit:
DLF is the responsible organisation for a cooperation - DLI - of 7 Danish teacher organisations with 170,000 members on policies regarding education and the labour market in the EU. 
 
DLI's objectives are: 
- to provide the member organisations with information 
 
- to coordinate the organisations' activities  
 
- to ensure the organisations' influence on debates and decisions in the EU 
 
The secretariat in Brussels 
DLI's secretariat is located in Brussels in the International Trade Union House, which also houses Education International, ETUCE, and ETUC. DLI's work involves participation in consulting procedures at European and national levels.  
  
To keep the Danish teacher organisations up to date, DLI also publish two newsletter on EU policy on a regular basis. 
   
The organisations of DLI are: 
Danmarks Lærerforening (The Danish Union of Teachers) 
Dansk Magisterforening (The Danish Association of Masters and PhDs) 
Forbundet for pædagoger og klubfolk (BUPL) 
Frie Grundskolers Lærerforening (FGL) 
Gymnasieskolernes Lærerforening (The Danish National Union of Upper Secondary School Teachers)   
Handelsskolernes Lærerforening (HL) 
Uddannelsesforbundet
